settings.uri-help: You can insert shortcodes to be replaced with the email value, see README.
settings.body-help: You can insert shortcodes to be replaced with the email value, see README.
settings.use-response-status: Use HTTP response status for validity status
settings.use-response-status-help: 2xx responses will be considered valid. 4xx responses will be considered invalid.
settings.response-success-key: Path to JSON attribute with valid status
settings.response-success-key-help: Path in format key1.key2.key3. Will be extracted with Laravel Arr::get helper. Value will be cast to boolean. Only has effect is HTTP status is not used. Exception will be thrown if response is not valid JSON.
settings.default-error-message-help: This message will be shown to the user when the email validation fails if no other message can be found. If you need this message to be translated, leave the field empty and customize the built-in default error message with Linguist.
settings.response-error-key: Path to JSON attribute with error message
settings.response-error-key-help: Path in format key1.key2.key3. Will be extracted with Laravel Arr::get helper. The default error message will be shown if this key is not found.

api.email-validation-error: Email did not pass external validation.
